snippet: Tens of thousands of Bahrainis turned out Friday for demonstrations to demand democratic reforms, the largest protest against the government in a year of unrest.
abstract: Tens of thousands of protesters attend anti-government demonstration in Manama, Bahrain; Shiites, who make up a majority of the population, complain about political and economic marginalization by the Sunni monarchy, accusation the government denies.
lead_paragraph: Tens of thousands of Bahrainis turned out Friday for demonstrations to demand democratic reforms, the largest protest against the government in a year of unrest.

headline.seo: Protesters Renew Calls for Reforms in Bahrain
